title.narrative: Magwi Maize Production Capacity Building Project

description.narrative: The grant will be used to construct a maize milling factory to process maize bought from smallholder farmers. The plant is estimated to process 14000 tons of maize annually to produce 70,000 bags of twenty (20 kg) maize meal and 20,000 bags of maize bran. The factory will ensure a ready market for smallholder farmers as Ubuntu will be buying directly from them. This will encourage local production as more landowners will be incentivized to engage in farming. The farmers will receive favorable prices for their crops and save costs by delivering their crops to the factory that will be located within the community. The local community will be guaranteed a consistent supply of affordable, quality and locally produced maize flour...The grant will also support the construction of an aflatoxin testing lab. The presence of aflatoxins in grains leads to health problems such as thyroid cancer as well as the financial loss for smallholder farmers who can't sell their products to the premium markets. South Sudan currently does not have an aflatoxin testing facility meaning that we cant tell whether the grains we are consuming are safe or not. additionally, Agro-processors struggle to source locally grown maize because of the uncertainty and rely mainly on imported maize. The testing lab will provide services to farmers, traders and millers to determine the quality of their grain. Therefore providing farmers with access to more markets and better prices for their uncontaminated maize. For Ubuntu, the lab will ensure that the company is compliant with quality assurance and food safety. The lab will enhance our revenue as well as income for the farmers.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: Compass Sesame Paste and Cooking Oil Marketing Project

description.narrative: Sector: Sesame, Town/City: Juba, South Sudan, Summary: The project will enable Compass Multi-Purpose Cooperative Society to expand its sesame paste and cooking oil processing business. Compass will utilize increased working capital to purchase more sesame from farmers and procure improved processing equipment, as well as construct a storage facility and processing house. During the grant, farmers and staff will receive training in financial management, cooperative governance, storage management, agronomy, sesame quality and marketing, and revolving fund management. This support is expected to increase the quality and quantity of sesame purchased from farmers and processed, thus bringing in more income to the cooperative and its member farmers.

title.narrative: Kuru-ko Wate Commercial Vegetables Capacity Building Project

description.narrative: Sector: Irrigated agriculture (jute, kale, cabbage, tomato, okra, pepper, amaranthus, pumpkin, watermelon, pig weed) , Town/City: Juba Nabari, South Sudan, Summary: The purpose of this grant is to expand Kuru-ko Wate Self Help's operations as a sustainable farming cooperative and ensure food security and increased income for its members. KKWSH will purchase vegetables from members and process them for resale in commercial markets. Activities will include laying a drip irrigation network to ensure a steady supply of water, procuring farming equipment and inputs as well as two rickshaws for transporting vegetables. Funds will also be used to sponsor financial management, monitoring and evaluation, business management and agronomy training in order to strengthen the capacity of the group.

The plan is simple; it calls for the drilling of shallow boreholes at a price that is less expensive than traditional companies charge for drilling services to underserved communities and small-scale farmers.

title.narrative: Whitaker Peace and Development Initiative (WPDI) - Kozi Organic Honey Processing Project

description.narrative: Project Name: Kozi Honey Supplies Location: Kozi Payam, Maridi County Summary: Kozi Honey Supplies plans to commercialize its honey business by purchasing honey from beekeepers and selling honey in bulk. They also plan on producing and selling small packs of honey and beeswax.

title.narrative: Whitaker Peace and Development Initiative (WPDI) - Bangolo Organic Beekkeeping Project

description.narrative: Project Name: Bangolo Beekeping Business Enterprise. Location: Bangolo Payam. Summary: Youth Peace Makers Network, a youth led enterprise has identified beekeeping as a profitable venture in order to tackle of the issue of poverty and conflict within their community. The project seeks to produce honey and beeswax as an income generating activity.

title.narrative: Peanut Paste Expansion and Marketing Project

description.narrative: Mangalla Women Development Association will use grant funding to construct a multipurpose storage facility to reduce post-harvest losses, purchase a modern processing oil expeller to improve efficiency and quality, purchase a truck to facilitate transport of peanut paste and oil to market, and purchase raw peanuts from its farmer members.

title.narrative: Cassava Processing and Marketing Capacity Building Project

description.narrative: The project is designed to improve standard of livings of members of GFMC and cassava outgrowers in Yambio through ollowing activities: construction of storage facility, provision of crop financing, procurement of equipment procurement, purchase of lorry and technical training of management and farmers in product quality and marketing market access.

title.narrative: FY23 South Sudan Partner CA

description.narrative: This award supports Foundation for Youth Initiatives (FYI) to serve as implementing partner for USADF in South Sudan. FYI will provide technical support to USADF grantees as they implement their projects.

title.narrative: Terekeka Home System Solar Project

description.narrative: Project Name: Terekeka Home System Solar Project.Location: Terekeka State.Summary: WADS Company Ltd is looking to install a stand alone solar power system which would be designed to carry a load of up to 205watts. The initial design is slated to provide electricity to 60 households with additional household added after the first year. They also plan to utilize portable water pumps and solar drier to improve economic activities such as fishing and agriculture in the area.

title.narrative: Gezira Maize Milling Project

description.narrative: Location: Juba and Renk, South Sudan.Summary: The project will enable Gezira Young People Agribusiness Trust Company Limited to increase its organization's revenues and farmer incomes by purchasing a milling machine and gaining access to funds to purchase raw materials from farmers.
